info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued April 06 at 7:19PM EDT until April 06 at 10:00PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 PM EDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN CHESTERFIELD...NORTHWESTERN CHARLES CITY... NORTHWESTERN PRINCE GEORGE AND SOUTHEASTERN HENRICO COUNTIES...THE CITY OF COLONIAL HEIGHTS...THE CITY OF HOPEWELL AND THE CITY OF PETERSBURG... At 719 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Chester to near Hopewell to near Petersburg, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and powerlines. These severe storms will be near... Jordans Point around 730 PM EDT. Garysville around 740 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by these severe thunderstorms include New Bohemia, Richard Bland College, Meadowville, Wayside, Birchett Estate, Varina, Barnetts, Elko, Jordan Point Country Club and Petersburg National Battlefield. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
